issue.title: Keep `/external:I...` on a single param file line

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
MSVC fails if `/external:I <some_path>` is broken into two lines in `.param` files. This is avoided by using the alternative `/external:I<some_path>` form.

Fixes #22614

body: Could you test whether https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/pull/22616 fixes this for you?

issue.title: [7.2.0] Using --features=external_include_paths on MSVC breaks compilation in Bazel 7 due to extra newlines in .params

milestone.title: 7.2.0 release blockers
milestone.description: Issues that should be fixed before 7.2.0 release.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

body:
> Could you test whether #22616 fixes this for you?

Is there an easy way to test with the build of that commit?
You can build a complete Bazel with `bazel build //src:bazel` on a local checkout of that branch. Prebuilt binaries will be available after this is merged.

Hi, I was able to build your branch with `bazel build //src:bazel.exe` and use it to build. I can confirm that it is fixed. I see in the params file that the newline is gone, and MSVC doesn't have the error anymore.
